title: "I love the people I work with and the level of Management directly above me."
pros: Company tries to do what's right with the patient at the forefront of all decisions. Very honorable company.
cons: Executive Management. Severely lacks imagination, slow to react to market dynamics that affect strategy, resources to representatives, and M.C. decisions.

title: "Good entry level position with opportunity for growth"
pros: Good career growth opportunities within the company. Able to get promoted 3 times in 4 years although some of that was due to lots of changes and layoffs opening up opportunities
cons: Lots of changes and news of layoffs across company. Morale lower during layoffs and hiring freezes present more work without the resources to meet the challenges of the new opportunities

title: "This company has a lot of potential but it needs to change its corporate culture immediately."
pros: Benefits, work life balance, flexible working hours.
cons: Lack of sense of urgency, commitment and accountability. The company doesn't know how to deal with low performers. Its under inertia mode.

title: "Incompetent and belligerent management, no team effort"
pros: Good money, benefits ok but have to pay a fair amount for them
cons: Bad climate all around, upper management looks for any reason to fire people, even if they are doing above average work

title: "Not as Fair as I Had Hoped..."
pros: Large Company; good benefits; opportunity to learn new preocesses
cons: No opportunity for advancement; when Merck "took over Schering-Plough", they "laid" off extremely qualified people (including myself) without even being interviewed. Merck took their own employees over Schering-Plough employees who had more knowledge and better skill sets. Merck obviously is a very nasty company, that will resort to any means to get ahead. CEO Frazier should be ashamed of himself for driving a company in this manner.

title: "Worst Big Pharma"
pros: Laid back good canteen and long lunch hours It was interesting working in different departments but then again nowadays most companies rotate new workers around divisions to see where they fit in best. There were no dress down days but work most of the time was laid back. I had to stay in the office sometimes for the whole day doing nothing - too many days of that and your days get boring and you do not learn nothing new.
cons: Poor Holiday package Office politics Poor communication within the hierarchy Worked with the team responsible for propecia (hair loss steroid) I felt guilty knowing the fact that did not work and caused long term damage to recipients of this drug - but hey I was trying to earn a living

title: "SP was a great company to work for"
pros: Culture, Salary and Benefits. Knowledgeable personnel are all pros of working with S-P.
cons: Merger with Merck ended the company

title: "Big Pharma struggling to survive in the changing healthcare world."
pros: Big company with lots of areas of interest. Lots of resources, studies, data available. Promotions are always from within the organization first. The company will survive the bad economy even if lots of layoffs are required.
cons: They are now hiring mostly contract reps at 50k with few benefits. Constant restructuring/downsizing of all divisions with little job security for anyone. Established employees are losing long held benefits such as pension.

title: "Decent base pay, sales potential and goals are arbitrary"

title: "Too much work for not enough people"

title: "Merck"

title: "Typical Large Pharma COmpany"

title: "Durham Plant Needs Some Work...."
pros: -Great pay for Inexperienced People -Close to my house
cons: -Management Have No Clue -Disorganized -No Accountability -Employees can intimidate Supervisors -Non Competitive for Experienced People -Hard to Move up the ladder

title: "Gave my heart & soul to the company @ the WP site and was laid off after 20 years of service when I turned 50."
pros: "Forbes' Most Admired American Company for 7 years"... 25 years ago. Looks good on the resume to say that you worked at Merck in the past. Pay and benefits acceptable. Severance package was great, but the company has scaled back on it for future severed employees.
cons: George Merck's quote "... medicine is for the people. It is not for the profits" is now largely ignored. It's all about the money and "do it fast Fast FAST". The West Point site used to have a "Pride in Quality" program that promoted quality and doing things right the first time - even sponsored a day in the summertime for the "Q-lympics" with fun & games designed to highlight quality and promote that mindset. That program no longer exists.

title: "Technician, Operations"
pros: Great new facility, Opportunity to learn and grow, pleanty of opportunities to make advancements if you have the skill sets
cons: Too far away from Raleigh (personally) Very rigid managerial style, goal to drive results sometimes unrealistic and affect quality of work/life balance

title: "Associate Scientist"
pros: Close to Train station to NYC. The stock is doing well.
cons: As a Legacy Schering-Plough employee, the pay is not equivalent to Legacy Merck and got demoted. I have to report my time with ADP time stamp program everyday.

title: "Great place to work!"
pros: Great benefits and salary, decent raises and bonuses every year. 100% matching for first 5% of 401K. Most people who work there have been with the company for decades and know what they are doing. They are great at trainining and developing newer/less experienced employees. The company rewards employees based on performance. People in my dept were nice and easy to get along with. Great work/life balance. Overall, it was a fantastic experience!
cons: The Memphis site has limited growth potential.

title: "High quality peers, too much change / unit time to be effective"

cons: Constant change in policies and organization results in low morale and inability to take projects to completion.

title: ">12yr R/D in process/bioprocess"

title: "Associate Technician"

title: "Good Company with Opportunity to Growth but slow salary growth"
pros: Great work life balance, opportunity to adjust working schedule to family needs, great opportunities for development and challenging work. Good benefits. Solid salary and bonus.

Company performance has been good last could of years but annual raises minimal due to company benchmarking and knowing they don't need to pay employees more. Non-aligned, cascading company strategy.

title: "The Worst Place to Work.  Hell Loses by 2 Points."
